data.name: Literal.Error.Address.Apartment
data.value: The apartment number is missing or not found. Please correct your address.
data.comment: The error message for invalid apartment number.

data.name: Literal.Error.Address.Charset
data.value: Sorry, you can only use English characters.
data.comment: The error message when data is in charset that is not supported by address verification.

data.name: Literal.Error.Address.DoubleConfirm
data.value: We cannot verify your address. Please verify your address and click "Next >".
data.comment: The error message when address verification system requires user to double confirm the address.

data.name: Literal.Error.Address.ID
data.value: Invalid apartment number. Please correct your address.
data.comment: The error message for invalid apartment ID.

data.name: Literal.Error.Address.Insufficient
data.value: Invalid address. Please correct your address.
data.comment: The error message for insufficient information for address.

data.name: Literal.Error.Address.InvalidData
data.value: Invalid address, please correct your address.
data.comment: The error message when data is missing for address verification.

data.name: Literal.Error.Address.Multiple
data.value: Invalid address, please correct your address.
data.comment: The error message for invalid address.

data.name: Literal.Error.Address.Pobox
data.value: PO box is not supported. Please provide your address.
data.comment: The error message for POBOX.

data.name: Literal.Error.Address.PostalCode
data.value: The postal code cannot be found. Please correct your address.
data.comment: The error message for invalid postal code.

data.name: Literal.Error.Address.Route
data.value: The route service identifier cannot be found or is out of range. Please correct your address.
data.comment: The error message for route service error.

data.name: Literal.Error.Address.Street
data.value: The street name cannot be found in the specified postal code. Please correct your address.
data.comment: The error message for route service error.

data.name: Literal.Error.AuthzFail
data.value: We can't authorize the payment method. Please make sure the information is correct, or use another payment method. If you continue to get this message, please contact your financial institution.
data.comment: The error message shown when card authorization fails.

data.name: Literal.Error.AuthzFail2
data.value: There was an issue during the validation of your payment instrument. Please contact customer service for assistance.
data.comment: The error message shown when card authorization fails. Probably, the PI is rejected by risk.

data.name: Literal.Error.AuthzFail.BR
data.value: This transaction could not be authorized. Please verify your information. Some payment cards may not be accepted on this platform, in this case, we recommend using an alternative payment card. If the problem persists, you may contact your financial institution.
data.comment: The error message shown when card authorization fails in Brazil. Probably, the debit / credit card that the user tried to add is not accepted.

data.name: Literal.Error.AuthzFail.MX
data.value: This transaction could not be authorized. Please verify your information. Some payment cards may not be accepted by the payment platform due to security policies in place. If the problem persists, you may contact your financial institution.
data.comment: The error message shown when card authorization fails in Mexico. Probably, the debit / credit card that the user tried to add is not accepted.

data.name: Literal.Error.CardUsedMuiltipleTimes
data.value: Your payment method has been added to too many accounts. Please try with another one.
data.comment: The error message shown when user tries to add an card is used too many times.

data.name: Literal.Error.CcExpired
data.value: Your credit card has expired. Please select an expiration date in the future.
data.comment: The error message shown when the credit card is expired.

data.name: Literal.Error.CcNumberInvalid
data.value: Your credit card number is invalid. Please enter a valid credit card number.
data.comment: The error message shown when the credit card number is invalid.

data.name: Literal.Error.DdBankCodeInvalid
data.value: Your routing number is invalid, please enter valid information.
data.comment: The error message shown when the direct debit bank code is invalid.

data.name: Literal.Error.DdBranchCodeInvalid
data.value: Your sort code is invalid, please enter valid information.
data.comment: The error message shown when the direct debit branch code is invalid.

data.name: Literal.Error.DdNumberInvalid
data.value: Your account number is invalid, please enter valid information.
data.comment: The error message shown when the direct debit account number is invalid.

data.name: Literal.Error.AccountIdInvalid
data.comment: The error message is shown when the billable account id is invalid.

data.name: Literal.Error.AccountLocked
data.comment: The error message is shown when the billable account is locked or disabled.

data.name: Literal.Error.EnterValidInfo
data.comment: The error message shown when user enters invalid information.

data.name: Literal.Error.EnterValidInfo2
data.value: Your payment method information is invalid. If you continue to get this message, try with another payment method or contact customer service for assistance.
data.comment: The error message shown when user enters invalid information.

data.name: Literal.Error.InvalidAddress
data.value: Your address is invalid, please enter valid information.
data.comment: The error message shown when the address is invalid.

data.name: Literal.Error.InvalidAddress2
data.value: Your address is invalid. Please make sure your address information is correct.
data.comment: The error message shown when the address is invalid.

data.name: Literal.Error.InvalidCity
data.value: Your city is invalid, please enter valid information.
data.comment: The error message shown when the city is invalid.

data.name: Literal.Error.InvalidPhoneType
data.value: Your phone data is invalid, please enter valid information.
data.comment: The error message shown when the phone type is not valid.

data.name: Literal.Error.InvalidState
data.value: Your state is invalid, please enter valid information.
data.comment: The error message shown when the state is invalid.

data.name: Literal.Error.InvalidZipcode
data.value: Your zipcode is invalid, please enter valid information.
data.comment: The error message shown when the zipcode is invalid.

data.name: Literal.Error.PhoneNumberRequired
data.comment: The error message shown when the phone number is missing.

data.name: Literal.Error.PiAlreadyExists
data.value: We cannot add this payment method because it already exists in your account. Please try with another one.
data.comment: The error message shown when user tries to add an card that is already added.

data.name: Literal.Error.PiAlreadyExists2
data.value: We can't add the payment method. Please make sure it hasn't been already added to your account. If you continue to get this message, try with another payment method or contact customer service for assistance.
data.comment: The error message shown when user tries to add an card that is already added.

data.name: Literal.Error.PiBanned
data.value: Your payment method is banned. Please try with another one.
data.comment: The error message shown when the PI is banned.

data.name: Literal.Error.PiExceedMaxOwnership
data.value: The information you have provided has been used by too many accounts. Please enter another account or mailing address.
data.comment: The error message shown when user tries to add a pi which has been used by other accounts for many times.

data.name: Literal.Error.PiLimitExceeded
data.value: Can't add payment preference. Use an existing payment preference, or to remove a payment preference.
data.comment: The error message shown when paper check last name is not correct.

data.name: Literal.Error.SaInIntermediateStatus
data.value: We can't complete your request right now because your credit card is being billed today for one of your subscriptions. Please use another card or try again later.
data.comment: The error message shown when the PI is in intermediate status.

data.name: Literal.Consent.Title
data.comment: The Consent popup Title

data.name: Literal.Consent.Content.AR
data.value:
In order to provide you with products or services it is required that you create a user account. Each time you provide a new payment instrument for a product or service we may provide the following notice and collect your consent before you proceed. During and for the purposes of account creation and/or adding a new payment instrument you will be required to provide personal data such as: your name, address, phone number, email address, credit card number and bank account number. We may also collect your IP address and your device ID and associate this information with the personal data you provide for account creation or when adding a new payment instrument.
I expressly authorize Microsoft Corporation, its affiliates and subsidiaries, to use the personal data that I have herein provided, in the terms prescribed by Law No. 25,326, Section 5 for purposes of sending me publications and/or advertising material concerning their offerings of goods and/or services. I hereby state that pursuant to Law No. 25,326, Section 6, I have been informed of the voluntary nature hereof.
Failure to provide data does not entail any consequence other than the inability to access the products and services provided through this web page. Should I provide my data, I would be expressly tendering my consent to having such data stored in the database of Microsoft Corporation domiciled in Redmond, WA 98052. The personal data’s owner is entitled to exercise his/her rights to access such data at no cost and at intervals that may not be shorter than six months unless evidence is furnished of a legitimate interest in doing otherwise as provided by Law No. 25,326, Section 14, Sub-section 3. The authority in charge of enforcing Law No. 25,326 is the ARGENTINE DIRECTORATE OF PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION and as such it is empowered to deal with any complaint and/or claim instituted on grounds of failure to comply with the provisions governing personal data protection.
You may access or modify your personal data at: https://commerce.microsoft.com. In the event you choose to modify your personal data you are hereby providing consent that allows Microsoft Corporation to collect and store your personal data as noted above.
By creating an account and clicking the “Agree” button below you agree to provide Microsoft Corporation with your personal data and you consent to Microsoft Corporation’s collection and transfer as set forth herein.
data.comment: Consent text for ES-AR

data.name: Literal.Consent.Content.HU
data.value:
In order to provide you with products or services it is required that you create a user account. Each time you provide a new payment instrument for a product or service we may provide the following notice and collect your consent before you proceed. During and for the purposes of account creation and/or adding a new payment instrument you will be required to provide personally identifiable information such as: your name, address, phone number, email address, credit card number and bank account number. We may also collect your IP address and your device ID and associate this information with the personally identifiable information you provide for account creation or when adding a new payment instrument.
This personally identifiable account information will be collected and immediately transferred upon account creation in a secure, encrypted manner to Microsoft Corporation in the United States to process your transactions and provide the products and services to you. Such data may be used and retained as long as allowed by law. Microsoft Corporation will not use your personally identifiable information provided herein for purposes other than those set forth herein, including but not limited to marketing activities.
Microsoft may disclose your personally identifiable information to third parties. Your information is transferred to third parties when doing so is reasonably necessary to process your transaction, comply with legal process, respond to claims, prevent fraud or act in accordance with governmental regulations.
You may access or modify your personally identifiable information at: https://commerce.microsoft.com. In the event you choose to modify your information you are hereby providing consent that allows Microsoft Corporation to collect and immediately transfer your personally identifiable information as noted above.
By creating an account and clicking the “Agree” button below you agree to provide Microsoft Corporation with your personally identifiable information and you consent to Microsoft’s collection, transfer and sharing of your personally identifiable information with third parties as set forth herein.
data.comment: ONLY for HU-HU! Consent text for HU-HU.

data.name: Literal.Consent.Content.IL
data.value:
In order to provide you with products or services it is required that you create a user account. Each time you provide a new payment instrument for a product or service we may provide the following notice and collect your consent before you proceed. During and for the purposes of account creation and/or adding a new payment instrument you will be required to provide personally identifiable information such as: your name, address, phone number, email address, credit card number and bank account number. We may also collect your IP address and your device ID and associate this information with the personally identifiable information you provide for account creation or when adding a new payment instrument.
This personally identifiable account information will be collected and immediately transferred upon account creation in a secure, encrypted manner to Microsoft Corporation in the United States to process your transactions and provide the products and services to you. Such data may be used and retained as long as allowed by law. Microsoft Corporation will not use your personally identifiable information provided herein for purposes other than those set forth herein, including but not limited to marketing activities.
Microsoft may disclose your personally identifiable information to third parties. Your information is transferred to third parties when doing so is reasonably necessary to process your transaction, comply with legal process, respond to claims, prevent fraud or act in accordance with governmental regulations.
You may access or modify your personally identifiable information at: https://commerce.microsoft.com. In the event you choose to modify your information you are hereby providing consent that allows Microsoft Corporation to collect and immediately transfer your personally identifiable information as noted above.
By creating an account and clicking the “Agree” button below you agree to provide Microsoft Corporation with your personally identifiable information and you consent to Microsoft’s collection, transfer and sharing of your personally identifiable information with third parties as set forth herein.
data.comment: ONLY for HE-IL! Consent text for HE-IL

data.name: Literal.Consent.Content.KR
data.value:
This personally identifiable account information will be collected and immediately transferred upon account creation in a secure, encrypted manner to Microsoft Corporation in the United States to process your transactions. Such data may be used and retained for up to twelve years from your last payment. You may contact Microsoft Corporation regarding the management of this personally identifiable information through the contact listed in the Microsoft Online Privacy Statement located here: http://privacy.microsoft.com/ko-kr.
Microsoft may disclose your personally identifiable information to third parties, including but not limited to CyberSource Corp., Receivable Management Services and Inicis. Your information is transferred when doing so is reasonably necessary to process your transaction, comply with legal process, respond to claims, prevent fraud or act in accordance with governmental regulations.
You may access or modify your personally identifiable information at: https://commerce.microsoft.com. In the event you choose to modify your information you are hereby providing consent that allows Microsoft Corporation to collect and immediately transfer your personally identifiable information as noted above.
By creating an account and clicking the “Agree” button below you agree to provide Microsoft Corporation with your personally identifiable information and you consent to Microsoft’s collection, transfer and sharing of your personally identifiable information with third parties as set forth herein and in the Microsoft Online Privacy Statement located here: http://privacy.microsoft.com/ko-kr
data.comment: Consent text for KO-KR!

data.name: Literal.PICVC.Input.Inform
data.value: A verification transaction has been charged to your credit card. Please check your statement and enter the exact amount charged to your account -OR- enter the 3-digit code found in the transaction description.
data.comment: Inform of input.

data.name: Literal.PICVC.TermOfUse.Content
data.value:
• We will charge an undisclosed amount between {0} {1} - {2} from your credit card.
  • The amount charged will be refunded to you as soon as you complete the verification process.
  • To get verified, you must input the exact amount charged OR the 3 digit code provided in the transaction description.
  • You can find the amount charged or the 3-digit code by checking your credit card statement. Depending on the service of your bank, this can be done online, by phone, or via paper statement that comes in the mail.
  • You need to complete this verification before {3}, and you have {4} chances to retry.
  • Depending on your location and the location of the bank issuing your card, the bank may charge an International Transaction Fee (ITF) or apply currency conversion charges to the amount charged during the verification process. To determine whether those charges might apply, please check with the bank issuing your card. ITF or currency conversion charges incurred in the verification process will NOT be refunded by Microsoft.
data.comment: PICVC term of use. {0} is for the currency. {1} is for the min amount to charge. {2} is for the max amount to charge. {3} is the exact time of challenge deadline. {4} is the left times to retry challenge.

data.name: Literal.PICVC.TermOfUse.Inform1
data.value: As an added security measure, we need to verify your credit card before proceeding.
data.comment: PICVC inform1.

data.name: Literal.PICVC.TermOfUse.Inform2
data.value: If you agree to this security measure, click Next to acknowledge your agreement and start the verification process. To stop the process, click Cancel. If the verification is cancelled or fails, your credit card will not be added to your online account.
data.comment: PICVC inform2.

data.name: Literal.PICVC.TermOfUse.Title
data.comment: Instructions

data.name: Literal.PICV.FailContent
data.value: Your {0} cannot be verified. Your {0} has been removed from your online account.
data.comment: Note: {0} stands for the PI challenge type, like: "credit card", "bank account".

data.name: Literal.PICV.RequireOne
data.value: At least one of the two fields is required.

data.name: Literal.PICV.SuccessContent
data.value: Congratulations! Your {0} has been verified and is now activated for use on your online account.
data.comment: Note: {0} stands for the PI challenge type, like: "credit card", "bank account".

data.name: Literal.PICVD.TermOfUse.Content
data.value:
• We will deposit an undisclosed amount between {0} {1} - {2} to your bank account.
  • To get verified, you must input the exact amount deposited OR the 3 digit code provided in the transaction description.
  • You can find the amount deposited and the 3-digit code by checking your bank account statement. Depending on the service of your bank, this can be done online, by phone, or via paper statement that comes in the mail.
  • You need to complete this verification before {3}, and you have {4} chances to retry.
data.comment: PICVD term of use. {0} is for the currency. {1} is for the min amount to charge. {2} is for the max amount to charge. {3} is the exact time of challenge deadline. {4} is the left times to retry challenge.

data.name: Literal.PICVD.TermOfUse.Inform1
data.value: As an added security measure, we need to verify your bank account before proceeding.

data.name: Literal.PICVD.TermOfUse.Inform2
data.value: If you agree to this security measure, click Next to acknowledge your agreement and start the verification process. To stop the process, click Cancel. If the verification is cancelled or fails, your bank account will not be added to your online account.

data.name: Literal.PICVD.TermOfUse.Title
data.comment: Instructions

Please send the Agreement to: Microsoft Ireland Operations Limited Atrium Building Block B Carmenhall Road Sandyford Industrial Estate Dublin 18, Ireland In addition, please read the entire Agreement below before accepting terms and conditions. Please click here to view and print the agreement.

data.name: Literal.PICV.SuccessContent.CreditCard

data.name: Literal.CreditCheck.PreWarning
data.value: Discover and pre-paid credit cards are not eligible for this offer.
data.comment: Pre warning for credit check.

data.name: Literal.CreditCheck.SSNInfo
data.value: We collect your Social Security Number (SSN) from you and share it with a professional third party in order to perform a credit check in order to determine if you qualify for the offer. We use technical measures to help protect against unauthorized access to, use or disclosure of SSNs. We transmit the SSN over a secure network and encrypt it prior to transmission. We do not retain the SSN after the completion of the credit check, although we will retain a unique identifier derived from your SSN for purposes of frequency controls. We will also retain the credit score and other information we retrieve as part of the credit check for as long as reasonably necessary to complete your transaction and for the detection and prevention of fraud.
data.comment: Info for SSN.

data.name: Literal.CreditCheck.ThingsToKnow
data.value:
This credit check should not affect your credit rating.
Your social security number will be used so that we can run a credit check and determine if you qualify for the offer.
You can make changes to your payment and billing information at a later point by going to https://live.xbox.com/en-US/account
data.comment: Things to know on credit check.

Your credit card company might charge an International Transaction Fee (ITF) or a currency conversion charge when you buy something from the Store.

data.name: Word.SEPA.TermConditions
data.value: By using this mandate, you have selected Direct Debit as your form of payment. Your use of Direct Debit is conditional on your acceptance of and compliance with these terms. You authorize Microsoft Payments Ltd. ("we" or "us") to request payment from your bank for amounts due to Microsoft. You must ensure that: (i) you have provided a valid email address for correspondence and notices; (ii) your bank will accept direct debit collections; (iii) you have sufficient funds on any due date; and (iv) your mandate has not been cancelled (except as below) or revoked. Failure to comply with these terms which results in non-payment, does not relieve you of your obligation to pay us any amounts owed and due. Please contact us to cancel this mandate or select another form of payment. We will cancel your mandate upon receipt of your notification. Direct Debit is available at our discretion, and if it becomes unavailable, we will contact you to arrange an alternative.
data.comment: The content of "Term & Conditions" for SEPA.

data.name: Literal.ACH.SubscriptionAgreement
data.value: By checking this box, you authorize (A) Microsoft Payments Ltd. ("Microsoft") to send instructions to your bank to debit your account, and (B) your bank to debit your account in accordance with the instructions of Microsoft. As part of your rights, you are entitled to a refund from your bank under the terms and conditions of your agreement with your bank. A refund must be claimed within 8 weeks starting from the date on which your account was debited. Your rights are explained in a statement that you can obtain from your bank.

data.name: Literal.ACH.SubscriptionAgreement.New
data.value: By registering or selecting your bank account as your payment method, you authorize Microsoft (or its agent) to initiate one or more debits for the total amount (including applicable taxes, fees and shipping costs) of your purchase or subscription charge (in accordance with the terms of your subscription service) from your bank account (and, if necessary, initiate one or more credits to your bank account to correct errors, issue a refund or similar purpose), and you authorize the financial institution that holds your bank account to deduct such debits or accept such credits. You understand that this authorization will remain in full force and effect until you remove your bank account information from your Microsoft account or Skype account.

data.name: Literal.ACH.SubscriptionAgreement.MSfB
data.value: By registering your bank account as your payment method, you acknowledge that it is a business account and authorize Microsoft (or its agent) to debit the value of authorized purchases. This authorization will remain in force until you delete your bank account information from your Microsoft account or Skype account.

data.name: Literal.DirectDebit.AllowPopup
data.value: To continue on to your payment provider's website, set your browser to allow popups.

data.name: Literal.DirectDebit.EnablePopup
data.value: To continue to your payment provider's website, please enable pop-ups in your browser.

data.name: Litterate.PayBitcoin.Description
data.value:
Please choose one of the options to add money:
• If your digital wallet software is installed on your computer, click the 'Pay with Bitcoin' button
• If your digital wallet is stored on your smartphone, scan the QR code

Please pay the exact Bitcoin amount as quoted below. You have 15 minutes to complete the payment. The page will automatically refresh once a payment is received.
data.comment: The help description for pay with Bitcoin

data.name: Literal.CSVGifting.Disclaimer
data.value: By redeeming this code, you expressly consent to the full value of the Microsoft gift card or code being added to your account balance and acknowledge that this means you lose your legal right to cancel this purchase and get a refund if such a right to a “cooling-off” period applies in your country. Your other legal rights are not affected. This transaction is subject to the Microsoft gift card terms and conditions.

data.name: Literal.Error.PolicyReject
data.value: Sorry, we can't accept pre-paid cards. Please try another payment method.
data.comment: The error message for RIME_PrePaid_List_POLICY_REJECT from RISK team.

data.name: Literal.Inicis.BrowserMsg
data.value: Customers using web browsers other than IE (Internet Explorer) will not be able to sign up for new Azure services due to ActiveX installation issue. Please use IE or a VM (Virtual Machine) with IE to sign up. After the payment method is registered, you will be able to use other web browsers for Azure services. We apologize for the inconvenience.
data.comment: Only need localization for Korean, other markets do not use it

data.name: Literal.Inicis.BrowserMsgActiveX
data.value: As this payment gateway is based on ActiveX, if you’re using other browsers (including Microsoft Edge) than Internet Explorer, you can’t proceed activating Azure. Please use Internet Explorer to sign up. After signing up, you can use any browser. Sorry for the inconvenience.
data.comment: Only need localization for Korean, other markets do not use it

data.name: Literal.Inicis.NameMsg
data.value: Please input your name in English in order to display it correctly on your receipts.
data.comment: Only need localization for Korean, other markets do not use it

data.name: Literal.Authorization.WarningMsg
data.value: You might see a temporary hold on your bank card statement. Your card will not be charged.
data.comment: Added to warn customers about authorization charges.

data.name: Literal.Authorization.Azure.WarningMsg
data.value: Your card will not be charged, though you might see a temporary authorization hold.
data.comment: Added to warn customers about authorization charges.

data.name: Literal.Error.AuthorizationFail
data.value: We can't authorize the payment method. If you continue to get this message, try with another payment method or contact customer service for assistance.
data.comment: The error message shown when card authorization fails for internal reasons.

data.name: Literal.Error.InvalidAccountName
data.value: Your account holder name is invalid, please enter valid information.
data.comment: The error message shown when account name is invalid.

data.name: Literal.Error.InvalidCountry
data.comment: The error message shown when country is invalid.

data.name: Word.LocalPaymentSubType.iDEAL

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.Heading
data.comment: [PIDL] 'Add a mobile phone' is a heading for a page, where phone number is collected from a user.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.MobileOperator
data.comment: [PIDL] 'Pick your mobile operator' is the label for a field, where user selects his/her mobile operator.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.PhoneNumber
data.comment: [PIDL] 'Your Phone Number' is the label for a field, where phone number is collected from a user.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.PhoneNumberWithSentenceCasing
data.comment: [PIDL] 'Your phone number' is the label for a field, where phone number is collected from a user, difference in sentence casing.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.Footer
data.value: When you select Submit, we'll send a code to your phone. Enter it on the next page. That way we'll know it's really you.
data.comment: [PIDL] A SMS would be sent to the user phone number, which should be entered in the next page.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.Disclaimer
data.comment: [PIDL] 'Standard messages rates apply.' is a disclaimer shown to the user that standard message rates apply for receiving the code on phone number.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.MessageRate.Text
data.value: Standard message rates may apply. See your mobile operator for details.
data.comment: [PIDL]

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.AgreementSequence1
data.comment: [PIDL] This is the first part of the text shown in the agreement of NonSimMobi. This string is concatenated with the following string

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.AgreementSequence2
data.value: , we'll send a code to your phone. Enter it on the next page. That way we'll know it's really you.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is the second part of the text shown in the agreement of NonSimMobi. This string is concatenated with the previous string plus "Next"

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.SMSCode
data.comment: [PIDL] 'Enter the code' is the label for a field, where a SMS code is collected from the user.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.SMSCodeDescription
data.comment: [PIDL] 'Enter the activation code' is the description for a field, where a SMS code is collected from the user.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.SMSCode.Invalid
data.value: Check and re-enter the code. The code you entered is not valid.
data.comment: [PIDL] 'Check and re-enter the code. The code you entered is not valid.' is the error description for a field, where a SMS code is collected from the user.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.Error.RejectedByProvider
data.value: Check your phone number. The mobile operator you selected says it's not valid.
data.comment: [PIDL]

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.Error.MOAccountNotFound
data.value: Check your phone number. The mobile operator you selected can't find that number.
data.comment: [PIDL]

data.name: Word.Error.LoginFailure
data.comment: This error is thrown when authentication is failed.

data.name: Word.Error.OperationCancelled
data.comment: This error is thrown when operation is cancelled by the user.

data.name: Literal.IdealBADesc.Help
data.value: Microsoft will make a € 0.01 Euro one-time charge to your bank account to verify your payment information. This charge will be refunded.

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.PaymentSummaryText
data.value: Sign in with ()EmailAddress anytime to use this payment method to buy digital content from Microsoft Store.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is the text that is displayed to the user in the payment summary page to convey that the payment instrument would be associated with the email address. The ()EmailAddress is parameter that is used and does not need to be localized

data.name: Literal.CloseButtonAccessibilityName
data.comment: [PIDL] This is the accessibility name for the close button

data.name: Literal.CreditCard.ErrorMessage.HasSpaces
data.value: No spaces are allowed in the card number
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown if the credit card has spaces

data.name: Literal.ErrorMessage.RequiredFieldEmpty
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown if a required field is empty

data.name: Literal.ErrorMessage.RequiredFieldEmpty.Backup
data.comment: [PIDL] This is backup error message that is thrown if a required field is empty

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.TooManyOperations
data.value: Wait a bit before you ask for a new code. Your requests exceeded the limit.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown if the user tries to enter invalid security code for the sms challenge too many times

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.InvalidChallengeCode
data.value: Check your code. The one entered isn't valid.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown if user enters an invalid security code for the sms challenge

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.PaymentInstrumentAddAlready
data.value: Add a different card. This one's already in your account.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown if user tries to add a card that already exists in thier account

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.ChallengeCodeExpired
data.value: Request a new code. This one expired.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown if user tries to enter a security code to sms challenge that has expired already

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.CardNumberOrExpiryValidationFailed
data.value: Check your card number and expiration date.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown if user enters an invalid Card number or expiration

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.ExpiryDateValidationFailed
data.value: Check your expiration date. This one's expired.
data.comment: [PIDL] This error is shown when either the card has expired or is invalid.

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.CardNumberAndPhoneMismatch
data.value: Check your card and phone numbers. They don’t go together.
data.comment: [PIDL] This error is shown when the user enters a Card or Phone nubmer that dont match.

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.CardNumberValidationFailed
data.value: Check your card number. This one isn't valid.
data.comment: [PIDL] This error is shown when the user enters a card number that is invalid.

data.name: Literal.ErrorMessage.ProcessorUnreachable
data.value: Try that again. Something happened on our end. Waiting a bit can help.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown if the processor is unreachable for the current provider

data.name: Literal.ErrorMessage.ProcessorTimeout
data.value: Try that again. The session with your payment provider timed out.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown if the request is timed out on the processor end

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.InvalidSecurityCodeOrPhone
data.value: Check your card security code and your phone number.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown if incorrect Security code or Phone number is specified

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.InvalidPhone
data.value: Try another mobile number or contact your bank.
data.comment: [PIDL] This error message is shown if an invalid Phone number is specified

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.InvalidPhone2
data.value: Check your phone number. This one isn't valid.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error is shown if an invalid Phone number is specified.

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.SmsFailure
data.value: Request a code again. Something happened on our end. Waiting a bit can help.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown if sending SMS message fails

data.name: Literal.ChinaUnionPay.ErrorMessage.InvalidPhoneInformation
data.value: Check the phone number you gave us or wait a bit to retry. We can't reach you.
data.comment: [PIDL] This is error message that is thrown the phone information is incorrect

data.name: Literal.CIBUpgradeTOU.SubHeader
data.value: You can now use your preapproved Microsoft payments authorization wherever PayPal is available when you pay on Microsoft.

data.name: Literal.CIBUpgradeTOU.MigrationText.US
data.value: Use PayPal for future payments on the Microsoft platform. If you have a PayPal balance, that balance will be used first, even if you have chosen a preferred payment method. If you have not selected a preferred payment method, your default payment method will be used. If your preferred or default payment method is expired or declined, PayPal will charge your backup payment method. You can set or change your payment method, or cancel this authorization at any time in your Settings at Paypal.com. Until you set a payment method in your Settings, the payment method used will follow the payment policies on PayPal.com.
data.comment: Text for United States, Canada, Brazil

data.name: Literal.CIBUpgradeTOU.MigrationText.DE
data.value: You agree that Microsoft can transmit your payment instructions to PayPal, so that you can pay with PayPal directly on Microsoft to Microsoft and to identified payment recipients using the Microsoft platform. You allow PayPal to share your PayPal transaction details with Microsoft including information normally shared with a payment recipient under our Privacy Policy. This enables Microsoft to see if your payment has been successful and to help fulfill your transaction. PayPal may let Microsoft know if you withdraw your consent. You instruct PayPal to treat payment requests sent by Microsoft as authorized by you. If you have a PayPal balance, it will be used first. If your default funding source is declined or expired, your backup-funding source will be charged. You can cancel this authorization or change your preferred funding source at any time in your PayPal account. If you pay in a currency that is not the primary currency of your PayPal Account, PayPal will convert the amount using our then current rate.
data.comment: Text for Germany, Netherlands, Sweden, United Kingdom, Russia

data.name: Literal.Accessibility.CCNumberMessage

data.name: Literal.MSFB.OrgProfile.LegalText
data.value: Where applicable, EU customers should provide details of their valid VAT registration number. Failure to do so may impact upon the VAT treatment of the invoice issued by Microsoft.
data.comment: MSFB update organization profile legal text

data.name: Literal.EG.OrgProfile.LegalText
data.value: Where applicable, Egypt customers should provide details of their valid VAT registration number. Failure to do so may impact upon the VAT treatment of the invoice issued by Microsoft.
data.comment: Egypt update organization profile legal text

data.name: Literal.MSFB.OrgProfile.LegalText.NZ.Line1
data.value: New Zealand goods and services tax (NZ GST) at 15% is applicable to cross-border remote services and intangibles supplied by non-resident suppliers to person resident in New Zealand unless the person is a GST-registered business. A supplier must treat the recipient as not being a registered person unless the recipient notifies the supplier that they are a registered person and provides their NZ GST registration number.
data.comment: MSFB update organization profile legal text for New Zealand

data.name: Literal.MSFB.OrgProfile.LegalText.NZ.Line2
data.value: In this connection, please provide the NZ GST registration number of your entity. If otherwise, NZ GST at 15% may be chargeable on our supply to you.
data.comment: MSFB update organization profile legal text for New Zealand

data.name: Literal.MSFB.OrgProfile.LegalText.NZ.Line3
data.value: If there is any change to your entity's NZ GST registration number or if your entity subsequently deregisters for GST in New Zealand, please inform us immediately.
data.comment: MSFB update organization profile legal text for New Zealand

data.name: Literal.MSFB.OrgProfile.LegalText.BR.Line1
data.value: Please enter a CNPJ if you are an enterprise/legal entity. Not entering CNPJ means you are an individual.
data.comment: MSFB update organization profile legal text for Brazil

data.name: Literal.MSFB.OrgProfile.LegalText.BR.Line2
data.comment: MSFB update organization profile legal text for Brazil

data.name: Literal.MSFB.OrgProfile.LegalText.UnknownCountries
data.value: This order requires additional credit approval to be billed by invoice. Please select this check box to agree to a credit check. You’ll be contacted for additional information. The order will be pending approval and no licenses can be distributed until the credit has been approved. This process may take up to two weeks to complete. (You may also change payment methods to proceed with the order.)
data.comment: MSFB update organization profile legal text for Unknown Countries

data.name: Literal.PayPalUpdateAgreement.AgreeAndContinue
data.comment: Agree & Continue button

data.name: Literal.PayPalUpdateAgreement.AgreeAndPay
data.comment: Agree & Pay button

data.name: Literal.PayPalUpdateAgreement.Heading
data.value: An update to your PayPal account agreement with Microsoft
data.comment: PayPal Scenario Strings - Heading for the update Paypal billing agreement page

data.name: Literal.PayPalUpdateAgreement.Subheading
data.value: By accepting this update, you'll be able to use your PayPal account wherever PayPal is available with Microsoft Pay.
data.comment: PayPal Scenario Strings - Subheading for the update Paypal billing agreement page

data.name: Literal.PayPalUpdateAgreement.Text
data.value: You agree to allow Microsoft to transmit your PayPal payment instructions to PayPal for purchases directly to Microsoft or an identified payment recipient utilizing a Microsoft platform. If you have a PayPal balance, it will be used first. If your preferred or default funding source is declined or expired, your backup-funding source will be charged. You allow PayPal to share your PayPal transaction details with Microsoft. The sharing of PayPal transaction details enables Microsoft to know if your payment has been successful, to help fulfill your transaction and provide payment receipts as identified in PayPal's Privacy Policy. You instruct PayPal to treat payment requests sent by Microsoft as authorized by you per the PayPal User Agreement. If you pay in a currency that is not the primary currency of your PayPal Account, PayPal will convert the amount using our then current rate. You can cancel this authorization or change your preferred funding source at any time in your PayPal account. If you withdraw your consent to use PayPal on Microsoft, PayPal may inform Microsoft.
data.comment: PayPal Scenario Strings - Agreement text for the update Paypal billing agreement page

data.name: Literal.Klarna.Add.Header
data.comment: Header for add Klarna page

data.name: Literal.Klarna.Add.Subheader
data.value: Klarna is a micro-lender. They pay for your purchase now. When your order ships, they email you an invoice and payment details. You agree to pay them back within 14 days of the invoice date. If you have further questions or need help, contact Klarna.
data.comment: Subheader for add Klarna page

data.name: Literal.Klarna.Add.Subheader2
data.comment: {ValidStrings=nb-no;"Betal etter levering med Klarna."}{ValidStrings=fi-fi;"Maksa myöhemmin Klarnalla."}{ValidStrings=sv-se;"Betala efter leverans med Klarna."}{ValidStrings=da-dk;"Betal efter levering med Klarna."}{ValidStrings=de-de;"Zahlen Sie nach Lieferung mit Klarna."}{ValidStrings=de-at;"Zahlen Sie nach Lieferung mit Klarna."}

data.name: Literal.Klarna.Add.Subheader3
data.value: Get your goods first and pay after delivery when you shop with us. No fees or interest, only pay for what you keep. Just select Klarna at checkout.
data.comment: {ValidStrings=nb-no;" Hver gang du handler med oss kan du få varene dine først og betale etter levering. Ingen avgifter eller noen skjulte gebyrer. Betal bare for det du vil beholde. Velg Klarna i kassen."}{ValidStrings=fi-fi;" Kun teet ostoksia meillä, saat tuotteesi ensin ja maksat vasta toimituksen jälkeen. Ei kuluja tai korkoja, maksat vain ne tuotteet, mitkä haluat pitää. Valitse Klarna kassalla."}{ValidStrings=sv-se;" Få dina varor först och betala efter leverans när du handlar hos oss. Ingen ränta eller dolda avgifter, betala bara för det du behåller. Välj Klarna i kassan."}{ValidStrings=da-dk;" Hver gang du handler med os kan du få dine varer først og betale efter levering. Ingen gebyrer eller renter, betal kun for det du beholder. Vælg Klarna ved kassen."}{ValidStrings=de-de;" Mit Klarna Rechnung schauen Sie sich Ihre Bestellung zuerst an und entscheiden dann, was Sie behalten möchten. Keine Gebühren oder Zinsen, zahlen Sie nur für das, was Sie behalten."}{ValidStrings=de-at;" Mit Klarna Rechnung schauen Sie sich Ihre Bestellung zuerst an und entscheiden dann, was Sie behalten möchten. Keine Gebühren oder Zinsen, zahlen Sie nur für das, was Sie behalten."}

data.name: Literal.Klarna.CheckBox.Text

data.name: Literal.MSfB.EditSepa.LegalString
data.value: By signing this mandate form, you authorize (A) Microsoft Payments Ltd. ("Microsoft") to send instructions to your bank to debit your account and (B) your bank to debit your account in accordance with the instructions from Microsoft Payments Ltd. ("Microsoft"). As part of your rights, you are entitled to a refund from your bank under the terms and conditions of your agreement with your bank. A refund must be claimed within 8 weeks starting from the date on which your account was debited. Your rights are explained in a statement that you can obtain from your bank.
data.comment: legal string for edit sepa

data.comment: Subheading shown to users in the United States during sign up for Office 365 trial. "()EmailAddress" is a placeholder and should not be localized.

data.name: Literal.OfficeOoobe.FR.TrialText
data.value: After your free 30-day Office 365 Home trial, your card will be charged 99,00 € TTC. Taxes may apply. Cancel anytime. We'll save your card so it's easy to use wherever you sign in with ()EmailAddress.
data.comment: Subheading shown to users in France during sign up for Office 365 trial. "()EmailAddress" is a placeholder and should not be localized.

data.comment: The text to show users that they can manage their automatic payment preferences on account.microsoft.com

data.name: Literal.CreditCard.CVVHelpDialogTextCloseCVVButton
data.value: CVV is the Card Verification Value on your credit or debit card. On Visa, MasterCard and Discover cards, CVV is the last 3 numbers on the back of your card. On American Express cards, CVV is a 4 digit number on the front of the card, above the main card number. Close CVV dialog.
data.comment: This is the text for the CVV help dialog

data.name: Literal.CreditCard.WhereIsMyCvvLast3DigitsText
data.value: Where is my CVV? The last 3 digits on the back.
data.comment: This is the hint for CVV textbox in xboxnative

data.name: Literal.CreditCard.WhereIsMyCvvFront4DigitsText
data.value: Where is my CVV? The 4 digit code on the front.
data.comment: This is the hint for CVV amex textbox in xboxnative

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.AddHeading
data.comment: This is the header for the add Non Sim Mobi flow.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.ChooseOperator
data.comment: This is the instruction to choose a phone operator

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.CodeInstruction
data.value: We'll send a code to your phone. Enter it on the next page that way we'll know it's really you.
data.comment: This is the instruction of how the OTP code works.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.ShowInfoHeading
data.comment: This is the heading for the NonSimMobi show info page.

data.name: Literal.NonSimMobi.ShowInfoMobileNumber
data.comment: {Locked="{msisdn}"} This is the users phone number for the NonSimMobi show info page. Localize everything that doesn't fall in the curly braces { }.

data.comment: This is the heading for the NonSimMobi delete page.

data.comment: {Locked="{({dataSources.paymentInstrument.details.msisdn})"}

data.name: Literal.PaymentInstrument.ShowInfoWarningText

data.name: Literal.AliPay.Instruction
data.value: You'll be redirected to the Alipay app to verify your account. We'll collect your Alipay account information, but won't use it without your permission.
data.comment: This is the instruction on how to add an Alipay pi to your account.

data.comment: This is the header for the Alipay show info page.

This includes contact details to prefill your application and information about your engagement with Xbox, including the duration of your Xbox account and when you last made a Microsoft purchase. If you click Cancel, the data will not be sent.
